Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "Machine Gun Preacher" and "Incendies". 

Both movies are set in different parts of the world, but they both deal with themes of violence, redemption, and forgiveness.

In "Machine Gun Preacher", Sam Childers (played by Gerard Butler) becomes a crusader for hundreds of Sudanese children who've been forced to become soldiers. The movie explores themes of violence, redemption, and forgiveness.

In "Incendies", twin sisters travel from India to France in search of their family history. The movie explores themes of violence, redemption, and forgiveness.

Overall, both movies are well-made and have excellent performances by the actors. I would recommend both movies to anyone looking for stories that explore themes of violence, redemption, and forgiveness.
